name: Red Bean Salad With Walnuts and Fresh Herbs
description: This is inspired by a number of red bean recipes from Georgia (the country, not the state). Walnuts, herbs, garlic and pomegranate juice show up in many Georgian dishes. I used pomegranate molasses, which is more of a Middle Eastern ingredient, in the dressing, and I love the sweet and sour tang it introduces to the dish. I prefer using small red beans that I’ve cooked myself, but in a pinch you can make this with canned red kidney beans.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, vegan, vegetarian, herbs, red beans, walnut, summer
recipeIngredient: 2 cups cooked red beans or kidney beans (rinse if using canned)
1/2 small red onion, cut in half lengthwise, then cut across the grain in thin slices (optional)
1 large garlic clove, peeled, halved, green shoot removed
1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes or 1/2 to 1 teaspoon Aleppo pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place the beans in a bowl and toss with the celery and herbs. Season with salt and pepper.
If using the red onion, soak the onion in cold water for 5 minutes, then drain, rinse and drain again on paper towels. Add to the beans.

In a mortar and pestle, mash the garlic with a generous pinch of salt and the red pepper flakes or the Aleppo pepper. Add the walnuts and grind together until the walnuts are coarsely ground but still have some texture. Toss with the beans.
Whisk together the pomegranate molasses, lemon juice, vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Whisk in the oils, toss with the beans, and let marinate 30 minutes. Serve.
